fields.description: It would be great if a 4th checkbox was added to the fetch dialog to allow tags to be pruned. This seems to be the same request as SRCTREEWIN-1309 but that was closed as a duplicate even though it doesn't seem to have been included.
fields.summary: Prune tags on fetch

fields.description:
Currently it can be quite difficult to check the history of a file in source tree. Its easy enough to discover the last commit that a file changed but then when you try to look at what actually changed it can be a bit difficult. 

Ideally you should be able to:
1. select a commit
2. select the file that changed
3. right click the file 
4. select compare with parent to launch your diff tool or file history to see a list of commits that this file was changed in and provide the option to compare the version of the file between any 2 commits.

This seems to be really easy in other tools but difficult in source tree. Its something i would use all of the time
fields.summary: Compare file to parent or previous version of file from a single commit
Source Tree Crash

fields.description:
# Switch to Log / History
# Select a commit 
# Select a file in the commit
# Click cog dropdown (next to search box) 
# Click External Diff

External diff is not launched. The menu item becomes checked. 

It works OK when Uncommitted Changes is selected instead of a commit.
fields.summary: "Cog" dropdown: External Diff not working
Source Tree just crashed

fields.description:
If a commit has a branch label on it, there seems to be no way to check it out without creating a new branch. 
Perhaps the "Checkout New Branch" dialog could allow an empty branch name for this purpose?
fields.summary: Allow "Checkout detached" on branch commits

fields.description:
In Sourcetree for Mac, HEAD appears in the Branches list on the left when HEAD is detached. 
This should be in Sourcetree for Windows too.
fields.summary: HEAD not shown in Branches list when detached
Crashed after entering in github credentials and progress bar went to about 99%

fields.description:
When looking at a {{git stash}}'s contents, it would be really beneficial (especially when you have multiple stashes) to know all the files which exist in the stash

 you guys should do an extra call when you are looking at a {{git stash}} within sourcetree in order to get all the names of files and list them when you select a stash from Sourcetree's stash dropdown list

Also it might be useful for terminal use to display the the {{git stash}}'s commit id too. I recently had an issue I was debugging where I needed the commit id
fields.summary: List files within a stash

fields.description: When I drag the commit pane to a different height, this is always reset to default (which is quite claustrophobic, tbh) the next time I start a commit. Even within the same session.
fields.summary: Commit pane height is not remembered

fields.description: When pressing Ctrl+Shift+C to go into commit mode, the textarea where you can type the commit message is no longer auto-focused. This was the case in earlier versions.
fields.summary: Commit field is not autofocused

fields.description: After I updated SourceTree to the latest version. The Checkout button went missing from the UI. It was typically between the Commit and Discard, I believe.
fields.summary: Checkout button missing from menu UI

fields.description:
It would be nice and useful to see the folder names that contain the project, in the project tab.
If I open two projects with the same name, but placed in two separate Source Tree folders, I now have no means to distinguish them in tab bar (see screenshot)
 !image-2016-06-09-16-25-11-072.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: See folder name in tab tootlip

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the Hosted Repositories windows, users are unable to create a repository using _Atlassian account_. (Indicator keep spinning)
 !ezgif.com-video-to-gif (1).gif! 

Log:
{code:java}
ERROR [2016-06-09 21:34:57,894] [1] [SourceTree.ViewModel.Hosted.HostingHandler] [GetScmHost] - Unable to List Repositories as the host ins not an SCM, [SourceTree.Host.Atlassianaccount.AtlassianAccountHost]
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View> Show Hosted Repositories windows or (Shift+Ctrl+H)
# Click _Create New Repository_
# Select _Atlassian account_
# Enter _Name_
# Click _Create Repository_

h3. Expected Results
_Processing_ indicator will keep spinning.

h3. Actual Results
Successfully create a repository

h3. Notes
* There's no Atlassian Account option when trying to add new Hosting Account.
Hence, I believe this Atlassian account information is acquired during ST 1.8.3 installation

* Users in Bitbucket Cloud are currently able to use Atlassian ID to log in to their Bitbucket account.
Hence, Bitbucket user might assume that the selected _Atlassian Account_ will work as well such as redirect to Bitbucket Cloud.

h3.Workaround
# Click _Edit Accounts_ in the Hosted Repositories windows.
# Click Add
# Choose _Bitbucket_ as Hosting Service
# Enter Bitbucket Credential (Username and password)
# Click *OK>Close*
# Click *Create New Repository*
# Select the _Bitbucket Account_
# Create Repository
fields.summary: Unable to create repository using Atlassian account

fields.description:
The checkboxes to stage/unstage files have disappeared. Not only the one in the heading, to stage/unstage all files, but also the checkboxes per file.

I was using those! I'm sure this is a bug, so please bring them back in the next version.

On a sidenote: it's weird that right-clicking a file also doesn't show a "stage" or "unstage" option in the context menu. It makes perfect sense there.. But forget that, I prefer the checkboxes!

If this was intentional: shame on you! Make it an option then.
fields.summary: Staging checkboxes missing

fields.description:
This problem has existed since as long as I can remember, so that's got to be at least 1.6. Now isn't it time to get this fixed, finally? The problem is that ST asks to press a key to accept the server's fingerprint, but before it does that, it appears to be pulling/pushing/whatevering forever.

Only when displaying the output, you see this message:
!Capture.PNG|thumbnail!

And the program doesn't do anything no matter how hard I press y (or n).

Workaround: switch to external Git. That will use a proper SSH library, instead of a silly background 3rd party program to build an SSH connection. And there's the problem. Relying on 3rd party programs that behave unexpectedly.

Please get this fixed already. It's been around for far too long.
fields.summary: Cannot access the remote with embedded Git

fields.description:
Panels and Windows should be scrollable by touch (not having to grab the scrollbar, not using mouse, not using mouse-wheel).
Touchable elements (like checkboxes) should be larger.
Elements that can be "drag-and-dropped" should be large enough and separated enough from neighboring elements to avoid accidental touches.
fields.summary: Touch-friendly UI for Windows 8, 8.1 and 10

fields.description:
It is possible when looking at a stash on the sidebar, files can be hidden from the diff which is displayed.

I had an experience yesterday which I stashed files (12 files) and when looking at the stash to restore the files, I was scared because it only showed 2 files stashed. After frantically looking around for the missing files, I resorted to the terminal and looking at the stash by listing the files, the stash did in fact include all of my files.

So somehow sourcetree, although stashing everything, only displayed part of the stash which made me think it was either the wrong one or I lost my data.

If it's any help the file paths which were displayed are listed below and attached is a picture of the actual files in the stash:
TTCWareNet/StartUp/bin/Debug/MFD_Compiler/Sourcery G++ Lite/header/expressions.cpp
TTCWareNet/TTCCardParam/Cards/NOVH4003_Card.vb
fields.summary: Stashed files can be hidden from source tree

fields.description:
I often work with multiple origins

 !image-2016-06-08-16-46-46-869.png|thumbnail! 

Aside of "Show Remote Branches"
 !image-2016-06-08-16-47-00-730.png|thumbnail! 
it would be nice to only show branches (remot, local or both) of only a specific origin

Thanks
fields.summary: Show only branches of specific origin

fields.description:
Sometimes the button labels disappear. Sometimes they are hidden when the application starts, and sometimes they hide themselves after a couple of hours of use.

Restarting the application works around this problem.

See attachment.
fields.summary: Button labels disappeared

fields.description:
* Select a file with diff in "File Status"
* Diff appears to the right
* Build the project so that some files changes (installer GUIDs)
* Diff disappears when SourceTree detects any change

Extremely annoying having to re-select the file I'm looking at several times while build is in progress in background, even if the selected file doesn't change at all

Multi-tasking is nice.
fields.summary: Changes to working directory cancels current file diff

fields.description:
I picked our company project from Bitbucket and waited until it managed to download it (took a very long time, much more than on OSX, it seems to be just waiting there until finally it shows the progress). After finishing I just clicked close on the screen that showed progress results and the whole program crashed. It was after a fresh restart.

Repository size is little over 700MB.
fields.summary: Crash after checking out a project from Bitbucket

fields.description:
If I open many tabs the repository name on the tab header gets shortened. How can I see the complete repository name to identify the "right" repository (e.g. they all have the same prefix)?

My suggestion (= the default behavior of many other applications):
* a Tooltip should show the full repository name on mouse hover
* the current selected repository (= tab) should be shown in SourceTree's window title
fields.summary: Tab Title improvements

fields.description: When I have cloned many repositories the bookmark view becomes bloated with unordered items. As a minimum it should be sorted by repository name. Any optional sorting, such as folder, origin, asc/desc would probably be nice, but don't let it block a simple first fix.
fields.summary: Sorting in bookmark view

I also tried reinstalling SourceTree from scratch, deleting local app data. It did not resolve the problem.
Using Windows 10.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on Windows upon launch, after fresh reinstall

fields.description: When right-clicking on a merge-conflicted file where one of the files to diff had been removed, the dialog appears indicating that the external merge tool is being launched, but then it just hangs there.
fields.summary: SourceTree fails to launch external diff tool if file has been removed.

fields.description:
I need to be able to access an Atlassian Stash Server that is protected behind an F5 Firewall.

The access requires the utilization of a SmartCard for the first authentication factor and then a username and password for the second authentication.

Source Tree needs to support two factor authentication with Smart Cards to support distributed enterprise systems. An Enterprise System is expected to host their own tools with tightly controlled access, utilizing open services such as GitHug or Atlassian cloud is not an option.
fields.summary: Two Factor Hard Token Authentication

The red arrow in the screenshot indicates the bar I mean.


Kind wishes ~ Patrick

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Remote URL change from '%40' to '@' during authentication due to character encoding.

Eg. 
The actual Source Path is _http://user1%40user.com@<IP Address>/path/to/repo.git_
During authentication, SourceTree change to _http://user1@user.com@<IP address>_ and prompts _{{error fatal: could not read Password for 'http://user1@user.com@1<IP Address>': Invalid argument}}_
 !Authentication.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an account username with '@'. eg. user1@user.com
# Clone a private repository with the URL : http://<Username>@<IP Address>/path/to/repo.git

h3. Expected Results
Error: 
{{fatal: could not read Password for 'http://<Username with '@'>@<IP Address>': Invalid argument}}

h3. Actual Results
No Error and the URL will be http://<Username with '%40'>@<IP Address>

h3.Workaround
Use the below URL to clone/pull/push the repository
https://username:password@<IP Address>/path/to/repo.git
fields.summary: Remote URL change from '%40' to '@' during authentication (Character Encoding)

fields.description: In SourceTree version 1.8.3.0 and versions below I've used, while scrolling the pending files to commit list, checking a file by pressing the spacebar doesn't enable the Commit button even though one or more files may be already checked within the list. To enable the Commit button, I always have to either check a list item, or uncheck and check a list item with the mouse. It would be nice to have the Commit button enabled just by using the keyboard option also since checking a list item with the keyboard is a feature supported on Windows.
fields.summary: Checking files in the commit file list with the keyboard should enable the Commit button
Automacao

I am using SourceTree for Windows. I frequently have two tabs open, one with my current project tree, and a second version open to a different point in the same project, for comparison purposes. Right now, the active tab is only differentiated by using a different shade of gray. I find it very confusing, trying to tell which shade indicates "active". Could we add a touch of pale blue, or something, to indicate the active tab? In other contexts. light gray communicates "disabled", not "active".

Thanks.
fields.summary: A touch of color...?

fields.description:
As outlined in this stack article - 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9614255/git-subtree-push-squash-needs-a-long-time-and-it-is-getting-longer-over-time

Eventually with time using a subtree will result in an ever increasing amount of commits that are squashed when pushed to the subtree. Git accounts for this with subtree split. 

Sourcetree should add gui support along side the existing push/pull features.
fields.summary: Git Subtree Split

fields.description:
A similar issue was reported earlier then later closed. [#SRCTREEWIN-535]

When viewing Unstaged files, I would love to have the ability to sort the list by file type (extension) or provide a filter to temporarily isolate certain files.

For example, I have a bunch of .META files that I don't want to commit at this time or permanently ignore, but I'd like to temporarily hide them so that I can see which .CS files have been modified. Being able to add an "extension" or "file type" column to the "Flat list (multiple column)" mode and sorting by that column would do the trick. A text field that would allow me to enter a wildcard filter should work as well. For example, "-*.meta" to temporarily remove the .meta files from the list.
fields.summary: Add sorting by file extention and wildcard filtering for the file views

fields.description:
The SourceTree diff gets very confused when it has to compare long lines (in my example they are about 5K-10K characters long). In the attached screenshot st_diff_confusion.png, the only diff present in the commit was the replacement of the four lines in red (displayed OK) with four slightly different lines in green, which would normally appear directly underneath the red ones (see the healthy example in st_diff_ok_on_shorter_lines.png). In the case of the screenshot, as you can see, the green lines went somewhere off-screen. 

I have also seen an example of the long red lines painting right over other lines of the file, but unfortunately cannot reproduce it in a screenshot now as this was with some intermediate diff I have not committed. I suspect though that the underlying cause is one and the same. Thanks.
fields.summary: Long lines break SourceTree (win) diff

fields.description:
When rebasing via Sourcetree i am not able to change the commit message to something starting with a hash. What we do is we name the #ID of the issue and then the title of the issue, for example:

#100 - Bug in the search form on the homepage
I tried this over and over and everytime rebasing fails with errors. Today i opened the terminal while rebasing and had to enter a commit message and read that the description with # in front is ignored. So that was the reason. I tried rebasing to:

100 - Bug in the search form on the homepage
and then it worked flawlessly. Also when i try to use:

#100 - Bug in the search form on the homepage
but then a slash is in front of the message.

It would be handy the make it in some way that # in the front are allowed as the original commit messages allow this too.

Using the latests BETA version.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Selecting an old version of System Mercurial in SourceTree is not working, without giving the user an error message


h3. Environment
SourceTree for Windows 1.8.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure you uninstall any new version of Mercurial
# Install an old version of Mercurial in your Windows machine, e.g. Mercurial 2.6.2
# Open SourceTree (latest version 1.8.3)
# Go to the menu {{Tools >> Options}}
# In tab {{Mercurial}}, select System Mercurial
# SourceTree will open a dialog asking you to locate your system hg.exe
# Find and select it

h3. Expected Results

Since an old version is incompatible with SourceTree, an error message should show -- indicating to the user that he should use a newer version of Mercurial

h3. Actual Results
Embedded Mercurial still remains selected.
No error message shows to indicate why System Mercurial is not being selected and used
fields.summary: Selecting an old version of System Mercurial in SourceTree is not working, without giving the user an error message
SourceTree conflict with Git 2.8.0.

fields.description: It takes to much. The solution to this is close and reopen the application
fields.summary: SourceTree Is too slow on stash changes

fields.description:
Stashes aren't working at all.

When I try to view a stash I get a loading indicator that keeps spinning forever.

When I try to delete a stash, I get an error message like this one:
!stash-error-1.PNG|thumbnail!

When I try to apply a stash, I get a different error:
!stash-error-2.PNG|thumbnail!

However, creating a stash works fine. But since after creation, a stash is virtually unusable, stashing code is currently a very dangerous thing to do.
fields.summary: Stashes don't work

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# User A makes changes to a File.
# User B makes changes to same file.
# User B does a pull this causes conflicts with the file.
# User B right clicks file, uses external merge tool (in my case Perforce P4Merge), looks at the changes, decides actually not to make any changes and will accept the origin copy of file and so does:
#* Switches back to SourceTree on the little popup merge dialog click [Abort]
#* Switch back to P4Merge, close, don't save changes when prompted.
#* Switch back to SourceTree - {color:red}*BUG*{color} The file has been move to Staged list even though viewing the file shows there are still conflicts, unstaging, right click on file and now all the resolve conflict options are disabled. I aborted the task but yet it thinks it has been resolved, in my eyes this is a big bug. The preview of the file in SourceTree is not sufficient to make a decision, but because of this bug there is no way to stop once you've launch the external merge tool.
fields.summary: Using external merge tool workflow is broken.

fields.description:
Clean install on Windows 10.
Logged into my account via the installer and selected a repository to clone from the installer wizard. I pressed the clone button and Sourcetree quit with a crash message.
After reopening I could clone the repository via the regular menu successfully.
fields.summary: Crash when cloning first repository from installer

fields.description:
After the step of adding a Bitbucket account, the dialog to provide proxy authentication credentials popped up, I entered the credentials and clicked ok. Afterwards a series of overlapping error dialogs appeared, the application crashed and now isn't opening (have checked that there are no stuck processes of it in task manager) - opening the application spawns a new process which very quickly disappears.

Crash log attached

Version: 1.8.3.0
fields.summary: Crash during initial setup and then refuses to open

fields.description: The embedded Git is still broken in 1.9.1. If I enable it, and do a pull, it's pulling forever. If I then tick "show full ouput" it looks like it's waiting for me to enter "y" or "n" to store the host's fingerprint. But no matter how hard I hit the "y" key, it won't budge.
fields.summary: The embedded Git is still broken in 1.9.1

fields.description:
when trying to use a big git project (git lfs) source tree no longer refreshes the repo.
and fails silently almost all operations, or just never completes.
and or get unexpected behavior.
fields.summary: sourcetree cant handle larger repositories when using LFS

fields.description: Fetch/Pull/Push windows should react to Esc key
fields.summary: Fetch/Pull/Push windows should react to Esc key

fields.description:
Bitbucket commits have the ability to parse references and actions to issues on bitbucket (https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/resolve-issues-automatically-when-users-push-code-221451126.html). Would be nice if SourceTree would parse the same and automatically link to those issues in a browser if a remote repository for bitbucket is setup.

For example, in the commit message details section, this:

ref [issue #7]

comment would allow you to click on the section in brackets and jump to that issue in the browser. Minor enhancement, but greatly useful for Bitbucket users using Issues and SourceTree. 

More generally, could provide the option for custom definitions of regexs and automatic linking within the comments section to any web url pattern definition (then could do bitbucket, github, or anything else)...Just makes SourceTree a little more powerful
fields.summary: Link to Issues

fields.description:
The "Rebase In Progress" dialog has a typo.

"It appears that you have a rebase in progress that was probably interrupted because of a conflict. If you've resolved the conflicts in your working copy, please choose whether to continue the rebase, or or abort this process where you are now."

Notice the duplicate "or" in "or or".
fields.summary: The "Rebase In Progress" dialog has a typo (duplicated "or or")

fields.description:
SourceTree Crash and close while trying to open a patch file generated by tortoise. See the version above.

See attached log
fields.summary: Crash when opening a patch generated by tortoise
